etymology.description: 艸(艸) (cǎo, 'grass') + 屯(屯) (tún, 'sprout') + 日(日, 'sun') = plants growing under the sun -> intermediate version of 春(春, 'spring')
etymology.interpretation: The character 萅 was an intermediate form of 春, combining the concepts of grass and a sprout (屯), with the addition of the sun (日), symbolizing growth and renewal during spring. Over time, 艸 and 屯 merged into 𡗗, which represented continued development through the seasons.
